quizzes.question: When creating a new project, your first step is to choose the...
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Create a New Project[/h1]

To create a new project:
Open Xcode from the [i]/Applications[/i] directory, and you'll see the Xcode welcome window. [img id="990" width="100%"] 
In the welcome window, click [b]"Create a new Xcode project"[/b] (or choose File > New > Project).
Xcode displays template choices in a new window.
In the iOS section at the left of the dialog, select [i]Application[/i].
In the main area of the dialog, click [i]Single View Application[/i] and then click [b]Next[/b]. [img id="989" width="100%"]

[h1]Project Options[/h1]

In the dialog that appears, choose additional options for your project.
[img id="991" width="100%"][b]Organization Identifier[/b]: If you don't have an organization identifier, use [i]com.example[/i][b]
Devices[/b]: Universal (A Universal app is one that runs on both iPhone and iPad).
Click [b]Next[/b].
[note]In the dialog that appears, select a location for saving your project, then click [b]Create[/b].[b][/b][/note]

[h1]Get Familiar with Xcode[/h1]

Take a few moments to familiarize yourself with the main sections of the Xcode [i]workspace[/i]: [img id="992" width="100%"] [note]You'll use the areas identified in the window throughout the lessons. Don't be overwhelmed; each area is described in more detail when it's time to use it.[/note]
